sub_title: PhD Candidate in Mathematics at Leiden University | Alumni of the University of Oxford | Kupe Leadership Scholar at the University of Auckland
summary:
I have graduated from the University of Oxford with Distinction in MSc and the University of Auckland with a First Class Honours. I am now a PhD at Leiden University. I am passionate about all areas of STEM. My goal is to further my research in pure mathematics, Number Theory in particular.

I consider myself an outlier: aged twelve, university student; fourteen, university teaching assistant and undergraduate researcher; fifteen, university Maths Club president; sixteen, BSc (Mathematics and Physics) graduate; eighteen, BSc (Honours) graduate and graduate teaching assistant; nineteen, MSc (Distinction) and PhD candidate.

Alongside my academic path, since the age of ten, I was featured in all types of media due to my unique life experiences and numerous volunteer efforts. For example, I have delivered well over fifty talks including at the World Science Festival in Australia and the Reading Festival in the UAE; founded an online learning hub; and started a monthly radio show to help motivate young people.

Discovering, contributing and sharing are my lifelong goals.

projects.title: NIWA Auckland Regional Science & Technology Fair
projects.description:
Triple Layer Milk Bottle - is it effective?

In this project, I carried out three lots of testing on the new Fonterra bottles for taste, light and acidity.

This project was awarded the NZIFST Award for Food Technology- 1st equal &
Material World - 2nd prize.

volunteer_experiences.description: "... Tristan Pang is inspired. He wants to share what he has discovered as a gifted young person in aiming high and following dreams. Tristan’s inspirational talks at schools, education conferences, organisations, and institutions have been well received and Tristan’s 15 minutes on radio offers inspirational talks, interviews, and stories from a youth perspective..."

volunteer_experiences.description: A completely volunteer driven initiative run by a group of passionate gifted learners to motivate students through talks and workshops: https://giftedgivingback.wordpress.com/tristan-pang/

http://tristanslearninghub.org/

"...Here you can watch videos where I will be going through topics strand by strand, i.e. you learn one topic, say triangles, then you go up this strand and cap off with trigonometry. This was the way I explored maths and it enabled me to cover all the maths curriculum from year 1 to year 13 before the age of 5. You will be surprised how quick and how easy you can grasp the concept by this vertical way of learning. And did anyone tell me to do it this way? No! I was just curious about this funny stuff and kept exploring. At that time (I think I was only two!!), I knew nothing about what year 1, year 2…year 13 meant. I ignore these year levels and keep exploring upwards. This is the reason why I won’t specify the year levels in my videos to remove your psychological barriers. I could do it, so, I am sure you can do it too. Maths is fun!..."

"...Life is full of fun. I enjoy every bit of it.  I created Quest-is-fun (QIF) just for fun. I want to share things with you, and I hope to inspire young people from ages 0 to 15.  Adults are also welcome to my site. Your comments are valuable to me..."

The Change Agents is a world-wide Twitter group chat aiming to change education by gathering different opinions from different people, especially students.

#changeagentsnz, https://changeagentsnz.wordpress.com/
